title: EW-Shopp: Supporting Event and Weather-based Data Analytics and Marketing along the Shopper Journey

author: Matteo Palmonari, University of Milano - Bicocca

segmentation: That's the first line.
OK, so this is EW shop.
It's project about.
It's an innovation action.
First, it's an innovation action to support event and water based data analytics and marketing along the shopper journey.
So basically what we want to do is to have companies to build like business services on top of whether an event based analytics.
So let's.
Start immediately with a simple example that we take from one of our business case.
So this is a company who does marketing campaign on search engines platform.

So the advertisers that you see under Google when you search for something and basically they manage a lot of campaigns like 300,000 campaigns in 74 different countries and the bid over 2 billion keywords daily.
So they really.
To handle a massive amount of data and they do campaign on that and then off and then of course they monetize on that.
So what's the idea of the project?
The idea of the project is that what's happening in the surrounding world has a huge impact on consumer behavior.
So if it rains then people search for bringing food home.
If it's sunny, people search for something to go out right.
So, and this is a nice example.
So here you can see that this is.

The performance of campaigns for the Sport Fitness category in Germany and there are all those peaks in searches over Google and it was very difficult for them to find out what he actually had the impact.
An impact on those peaks and the reason is that they found out that there was like words manhandled championship matches of German team and this had like this huge.
Impact now of course, you cannot search those patterns and manually.
If you run campaigns at that scale.
So you need some automation and to derive some patterns and predict some analytics.

So what they did here is that they're building this service to optimize their campaign so that they put the keywords that they want to bid in, and this service is tell them look, it's better that you activate this campaigning this day, becausw.
We predict that the weather would optimize the impression of your campaign, right?
So this is an example.

Of course, we have several examples of this kind of this of this kind, like in the E Commerce domain prediction of clicks retail, so sales, customer relationship management inbound and outbound call in store visits an for all of these business cases, the companies want to monetize on top of business services that require some analytics.
So.
So what's the main idea of the project?
Since 80% of the cost in data analytics project is due to the data preparation phase, we want to reduce those costs.
So we are building some technology that should help those companies to enrich the data in such a way that they can analyze the data and then they can build those services.
And we do this and.
So we charged the.
Semantic web, most related challenges in the project, of course, data are harmonization, like in the case I've discussed that we have to enrich 250 gigabytes of data.
Each country and there are like 74 countries, so this gives you an idea of the data we need to enrich them with weather information, event information and so on and so forth.
So we have a huge volume and variety problem.
And of course another problem is to deal with event data at large scale.
So what's our contributions?
So we have contributions both on the data preparation side than on the analytics side on the data preparation side.

We built like this tool for scalable data enrichment, which is basically I would call it a kind of smarter openrefine tool, which could deal with massive amount of data and has more intelligence in inside.
And then we have of course that develop models for weather and even based their predictive analytics.
And this is mainly Joseph Stephen work.
So in summary, what we have to offer and what we would like to get from you.
If you are interested, we have those tools that are made for data manipulation and data enrichment.

These tools can be used to generate the knowledge graphs, but even if you are not interested in having the knowledge graph, you can just extend that your data in such a way that you can feed those analytic models.
Now the nice thing is that we invested a lot in the infrastructure in the software and that was.
Reilly arts.
And So what I would say to the people working in this domain.
If you have intelligent algorithms, you don't need to build the tool from scratch.
You can just plug in your intelligent algorithms in our tool and we can build a like this Community driven tool that could work properly.
'cause actually current tool do not work and cannot be used then we have a Q minor which is a library for effective and efficient predictive and descriptive analytics.
Which is for those.

For those analytics and we also have a tool upset for knowledge graph summarization and profiling that we have demoed several times at these conferences and So what we would like to have again, it's like contribution.
You can plug your table annotation services in our tool and you can use.
It is open source so you can have your own instance.
It's something that can be deployed even on cloud infrastructure.
You can build your reconciliation services.
We would like to have more special information.
Hops causes.
Partial reconciliation is a very important problem in most of analytics application.

And finally, if you have like a use cases so maybe you are doing something similar like the Crowd project an you an you can say OK so I can see what I'm doing as enrichment problem problem we can offer this tool and we can build on top of that.
And of course, if you have an event and water based analytics use case that we we can contribute.
So I just forget to tell this.
